result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in Court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return. Defendant has THREE CASES: 22CF348, 22CF411, and 21CF5312. Court reviewed Competency Report dated June 30, 2022 and submitted by Dr. Matthew Seipel. Discussion placed on the record. Parties reviewed and did not contest the Doctor's Report dated June 30, 2022. Defendant confirmed. Court found the Defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense. Court ordered proceedings suspended. Court ordered Defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Court further authorized DHS to administer medications and treatment to the Defendant. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. Court ordered case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. DEFENDANT WILL APPEAR VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Competency report.  Received and Filed.  nk
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.  Received and Filed.  nk
Signed and filed.

Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return. The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. Court approves for the psychological evaluation report to used in te defendant's Rock County court cases. Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cover sheet for confidential records, Filed
Competency eval 971.14(2), Filed
Order for Compentency Evaluation, Signed and filed.   mn

Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in court via zoom and with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared Stephan Nolten for the State of Wisconsin.   Alexandria S. Carlson appearing for Stephan Nolten via zoom for the State of Wisconsin.   Letter from Nancy Elliott, Ph.D. which states defendant may require an inpatient evaluation.  Defense conversed via zoom with defendant. Statements made by parties.  The Court will suspend proceedings and order an in-patient evaluation, according to 971.14(2).  Defendant is currently at Rock County Jail and is to be transported to an in patient facility.  Order for Competency Examination signed by the Court.  Defendant is remanded into the custody of Rock County Sheriff's department.  Case is adjourned for Return on Doctor's Report in Br 45.   mn  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
MCFARLING REFUSAL LTR, filed.

-received and filed.
Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jayvon Armonte McFarling in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jayvon Armonte McFarling appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d66d5f44-cf7a-0e03-96c5-92d4fbbd91a4  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
